tit.e: Tenpo-Oban (Large-Sized Gold Coin of the Tenpo Era)
tit.cmt: 統一事項に従って補足説明を加えました。
tit.e: Tenpo-Oban (Large-Sized Gold Coin of the Tenpo Era)

sen.j: 天保大判（てんぽうおおばん）とは天保9年（1838年）6月24日より発行された大判である。
sen.e: Tenpo-Oban refers to a large-sized gold coin released on June 24, 1838.
Tenpo-Oban refers to a large-sized gold coin issued from August 13, 1838.
sen.cmt: ・旧暦を修正しました。・releasedは製品発売などで使われ、貨幣は継続的に作られるものなのでissued fromとしました。
sen.e: Tenpo-Oban refers to a large-sized gold coin issued from August 13, 1838.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 吹替え（改鋳）によるものではなく、享保大判と同形式であり金品位も近く、吹増大判（ふきましおおばん）あるいは吹継大判（ふきつぎおおばん）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It was not issued because of currency reform, and it looked similar to and had the content of gold close to that of Kyoho-Oban, and was also called fukimashi Oban or fukitsugi Oban.
sen.cmt: 切らずに一文でつなげた。
sen.e: It was not issued because of currency reform, and it was similar in shape to and close in gold quality to Kyoho-Oban (large-sized coin of the Kyoho era), and was also called fukimashi Oban or fukitsugi Oban.
sen.cmt: ・Kyoho-Obanはそのままでは意味が通じないため補足しました。
sen.e: It was not issued because of currency reform, and it was similar in shape to and close in gold quality to Kyoho-Oban (large-sized coin of the Kyoho era), and was also called fukimashi Oban or fukitsugi Oban.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天保8年（1837年）8月から鋳造された五両判はもともと大判座の後藤十五代真乗が発案したものであったが、通貨であることを理由に金座に鋳造担当を奪われたことから大判座の財政難対策に苦慮していたところに登場した大判鋳造であり、大判座救済策の意味合いもあったとされる。
sen.e: Go-ryo (five-ryo) ban coin minted from August 1837 was originally the idea of Shinjo GOTO the fifteenth of Obanza (an organization associated with minting), however, the coin was also to be intended for bail-out measure for the organization because it was an Oban minting emerged at the time when the organization was struggling to cope with economic difficulties after they had lost the role to mint coins to Kinza (gold mint) because the coin was currency.
sen.cmt: 五両についてfive-ryoと説明を補足した。大判座について少し（ ）に補足。
sen.e: Go-ryo ban (five-ryo coin) minted from August 1837 was originally the idea of Shinjo GOTO the fifteenth of Obanza (an organization associated with minting); however, the coin is also said to have been intended for bail-out measure for the organization because Oban minting emerged at the time when the organization was struggling to cope with economic difficulties after they had lost the role to mint coins to kin-za (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of gold during the Edo period) because the coin was currency.
sen.cmt: ・「五両判」は現状では意味がとりづらいため修正しました。・howeverは接続詞ではないので、直前のコンマをセミコロンにしました。・表現が分かりづらかったためit was an Oban minting emerged→Oban minting emergedに修正しました。
sen.e: Go-ryo ban (five-ryo coin) minted from August 1837 was originally the idea of Shinjo GOTO the fifteenth of Obanza (an organization associated with minting); however, the coin is also said to have been intended for bail-out measure for the organization because Oban minting emerged at the time when the organization was struggling to cope with economic difficulties after they had lost the role to mint coins to kin-za (an organization in charge of casting and appraising of gold during the Edo period) because the coin was currency.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

tit.cmt: 統一用語に従って変更しました。

sen.j: 表面は「拾両後藤（花押）」と墨書され、後藤十六代方乗、十七代典乗の書であり、上下左右に丸枠桐極印がそれぞれ一箇所、計四箇所打たれ、形状はやや角ばった楕円形である。
sen.e: It had the letters "ju-ryo (ten-ryo) GOTO (written seal mark)" written with indian-ink by Hojo GOTO the sixteenth and Tenjo the seventeenth on its surface, and it was a little angular, oval coin with a hallmark of paulownia in a circle each on the upper, lower, left and right parts of it.
sen.cmt: 「拾両」に（ ）を補足した。
sen.e: It had the letters '拾両後藤 (written seal mark)' (ten-ryo Goto) written with indian-ink by Hojo GOTO the sixteenth and Tenjo the seventeenth on its surface, and it was a little angular, oval coin with a hallmark of paulownia in a circle each on the upper, lower, left and right parts of it.
sen.cmt: 墨書されていた文字自体が問題になると思われるため、漢字を残しました。
sen.e: It had the letters '拾両後藤 (written seal mark)' (ten-ryo Goto) written with indian-ink by Hojo GOTO the sixteenth and Tenjo the seventeenth on its surface, and it was a little angular, oval coin with a hallmark of paulownia in a circle each on the upper, lower, left and right parts of it.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 表面の鏨目（たがねめ）がやや太く熨斗目（のしめ）に近く、極印の形状が異なることなどから享保大判と区別される。
sen.e: It was distinguishable from Kyoho-Oban because of the reasons including the thickness of the engraved short lines and the different figures of hallmarks on its surface.
sen.cmt: たがね目と熨斗目については直訳せずに、engraved short linesとした。
sen.e: It was distinguishable from Kyoho-Oban for reasons including the thickness of the engraved short lines and the different figures of hallmarks on its surface.
sen.cmt: ・because of the reasons→for reasonsに修正しました。・shrt→shortのスペルミスのようです。
sen.e: It was distinguishable from Kyoho-Oban for reasons including the thickness of the engraved short lines and the different figures of hallmarks on its surface.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 裏面中央に丸枠桐紋、亀甲桐紋、花押の極印に加え、左下に座人極印が打たれる。
sen.e: In addition to hallmarks of paulownia patterns in a circle and a hexagon and written seal mark at the center on its back, a hallmark of hereditary officer was engraved on the lower left.
In addition to hallmarks of paulownia patterns in a circle and in a hexagon and written seal mark at the center on its back, a hallmark of hereditary officer was engraved on the lower left.
sen.cmt: a hexagonが何と並ぶかがわかりづらいため、inを付け加えました。
sen.e: In addition to hallmarks of paulownia patterns in a circle and in a hexagon and written seal mark at the center on its back, a hallmark of hereditary officer was engraved on the lower left.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 裏面の極印による鋳造高は、天保9年（1838年）6月21日より8月28日までは「方・次・丘」2枚（見本金）、「伊・三・丘」243枚、「伊・文・丘」224枚、「伊・次・丘」154枚であり、内7枚が潰金となり、同年9月26日から12月2日までは156枚（極印不詳）が鋳造され、天保11年（1840年）12月23日より12年（1841年）4月21日までは「い・宇・川」および「は・宇・川」の計1,115枚が鋳造された。
sen.e: When it comes to the minting output with hallmarks on its back, between June 21and August 28, 1838, two (sample gold) coins with "kata, tsugi, oka," 243 coins with "i, three, oka," 224 coins with "i, bun, oka," 154 coins with "i, tsugi, oka," were minted and seven out of the above-mentioned were crushed; between September 26 and December 2, 1838, 156 coins (hallmarks unconfirmed) were minted; and between December 23, 1840 and April 21, 1841, in total, 1,115 coins with either of "i, u, kawa," or "ha, u, kawa," were minted.

When it comes to minting output by hallmark on the back, between August 10 and October 16, 1838, two (sample gold) coins with '方, 次, 丘' (kata, tsugi, oka), 243 coins with '伊, 三, 丘' (i, three, oka), 224 coins with '伊, 文, 丘' (i, bun, oka), 154 coins with '伊, 次, 丘' (i, tsugi, oka) were minted and seven out of the above-mentioned were crushed; between November 12, 1838, and January 16, 1839, 156 coins (hallmarks unconfirmed) were minted; and between January 15, 1841, and June 10, 1841, in total, 1,115 coins with either 'い, 宇, 川' (i, u, kawa), or 'は, 宇, 川' (ha, u, kawa) were minted.
sen.cmt: ・極印の読みが確定できているかが不明です。調査では不明でした。・旧暦を修正しました。
sen.e: When it comes to minting output by hallmark on the back, between August 10 and October 16, 1838, two (sample gold) coins with '方, 次, 丘' (kata, tsugi, oka), 243 coins with '伊, 三, 丘' (i, three, oka), 224 coins with '伊, 文, 丘' (i, bun, oka), 154 coins with '伊, 次, 丘' (i, tsugi, oka) were minted and seven out of the above-mentioned were crushed; between November 12, 1838, and January 16, 1839, 156 coins (hallmarks unconfirmed) were minted; and between January 15, 1841, and June 10, 1841, in total, 1,115 coins with either 'い, 宇, 川' (i, u, kawa), or 'は, 宇, 川' (ha, u, kawa) were minted.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元文小判に対し含有金量に基づけば十一両三分であったところに十両という相場が定着していた。
sen.e: While, the price of the Oban was supposed to be eleven-ryo three-bu to Genbun-Koban according to the content of gold, but the actual price was fixed at ten-ryo, merchants stored the Oban away, which led to a lack of Oban available, and later the Oban prices which had climbed to twenty-ryo to Bunsei-Koban and thirty two-ryo to Tenpo-Koban were lowered and settled at twenty-ryo two-bu because of the release of Tenpo-Oban.
While the price of the Oban was supposed to be eleven-ryo three-bu to Genbun-Koban according to the content of gold, the actual price was fixed at ten-ryo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: While the price of the Oban was supposed to be eleven-ryo three-bu to Genbun-Koban according to the content of gold, the actual price was fixed at ten-ryo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そんな中、商人による大判の退蔵が行われ大判の調達に不足をきたし、その後、文政小判に対し二十両、天保小判に対し三十二両まで高騰していた大判相場が、天保大判の発行により下落し二十両二分で落ち着いた。
sen.e: Under such a circumstance, merchants stored the Oban away, which led to a lack of Oban available, and later the Oban prices which had climbed to twenty-ryo to Bunsei-Koban and thirty two-ryo to Tenpo-Koban were lowered and settled at twenty-ryo two-bu because of the issuance of Tenpo-Oban.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処・releaseは不適切なためissuedとしました。
sen.e: Under such a circumstance, merchants stored the Oban away, which led to a lack of Oban available, and later the Oban prices which had climbed to twenty-ryo to Bunsei-Koban and thirty two-ryo to Tenpo-Koban were lowered and settled at twenty-ryo two-bu because of the issuance of Tenpo-Oban.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 通用期間は天保9年（1838年）6月24日より、万延元年（1860年）4月10日までであり、享保大判と並行して流通した。
sen.e: The period of currency was from June 24, 1838 to April 10, 1860, concurrently with Kyoho-Oban.
The currency was used from August 13, 1838 to May 30, 1860, concurrently with Kyoho-Oban.
sen.cmt: 不自然な表現を修正しました。
sen.e: The currency was used from August 13, 1838 to May 30, 1860, concurrently with Kyoho-Oban.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
